Reviews.Content: O.K. for the price, but I would pay a little extra  This hotel was O.K. for the price, but I would pay a little more  stay somewhere else. I laughed when I saw the room. There were 3 single beds. No phone. Difficult to figure out the TV. Couldn't figure it out 'til the next morning. Left over soap in the shower  someone's half used shampoo bottle. Couldn't find anywere to turn up the heat  the room was cold. Duvets on the bed. Pancake flat pillow. I stayed one night in Dec. of '07. The hotel website had a rate of something like 70 euro. I got a deal on Orbitiz for something like 40 euros. The hotels around the airport seemed expensive. I arrived late  left rather early. The one reasonable priced hotel near the airport, I cancelled because of poor trip advisor reviews. Past customers said the the airport shuttle was iffy  one could get stuck paying an expensive cab to that hotel. This hotel offered breakfast. They were out of hard boiled eggs in the morning. Usual rolls w/ jam, coffee or tea. For the price, of course it was worth it,  better than staying at the airport, which I wouldn't do. And, better than paying exorbant airport hotel prices. I had a nice gentlemen help me figure out the train. He was actually going to the downtown train station  switching there, so he rode w/ me  helped me find my way. At the train station, I went into a store  asked for additional help. Without all the help, figuring out the train would have been stressful for me. It is 3.60 euro 1-way to ride the train directly from the airport to the downtown station. The train station is supposed to be in the red light district, full of drugs  prostitutes. I didn't see this, but I did see one lady drinking alcohol in the open that was unsavory. At the train station, I walked up the stairs, turned right out the door, turned right on the street,  walked to the end of the block,  turned left. The hotel is a minute-ish walk. There looked to be a nice pub around the block. And you could walk down to the river  to old town Frankfurt where there were apple wine taverns, etc. The location is good. The towels were threadbare  worn. It was clean. Not sure about the left over soap  shampoo bottle though? I still think I would pay a little more  stay somewhere nicer. It didn't look like the website. I had to cancel w/ Orbitz on a return stay as I had to shorten my trip  had no problems w/ the cancellation. No cancellation fee  no problems w/ the hotel. The front desk clerk was nice. The breakfast women did not seem friendly.
Reviews.Author: wanderlustak

Reviews.Content: Good location budget 50 euro/night. Good location, 1 block from main train station. Good overall for a budget hotel, not elevator but only 5 stories. Everything works and clean. Quiet side of the street, face away from the main station. Plenty of place to eat in the train terminal. Short walk to the river and downtown. Breakfast is standard boil egg, waffle, cereal. I booked by calling the hotel directly with no issue. Lots of traffic around the train station, always felt safe.
Reviews.Author: BuckGee

Reviews.Content: Be Forewarned! STAY AWAY from Hotel Paris, Frankfurt, Germany!We did our homework and chose this hotel based upon the reviews found here and on other travel website forums, but let me tell you 鈥?br/>In March 鈥?7 we reserved a room with Hotel Paris in Frankfurt, Germany through Expedia for a 1-night stay in September. During the first two weeks of September, my father, aged 71, and I traveled throughout Germany, without incident, for 11 days. Of seven 6-month advance reservations, only one was NOT HONORED 鈥?Hotel Paris.Upon arrival, we were informed that our reservations had been 鈥渃ancelled鈥? Shocked, we advised we had no such communication from Expedia to that effect prior to our departure. We were further informed the room rate would be E250.00 not E70.00 due 鈥渢o a trade fair underway鈥?Only after considerable debate did Hotel Paris agree to 鈥渞educe鈥?the rate to E150.00. However, we were advised 鈥渙nly two rooms were available鈥?鈥?one on the fifth floor, the other in the basement. Hotel Paris has NO elevator. We 鈥渃hose鈥?the latter as ascending many flights was not agreeable.The room was deplorable. It stank of a horrible disinfectant. When we opened the window for fresh air 鈥?pigeon feathers blew into the room. There was no window shade; at night the light from the hotel sign illuminated our room. And passers-by could be seen and heard on the street.I have never and hope never again to have to endure such dismal accommodations.Hotel Paris鈥?actions could best be described as 鈥渆xtortive鈥? We signed the credit card receipt, 鈥淩oom rate under protest鈥?and we were hopeful, working with our credit card company, Hotel Paris could be persuaded to 鈥渄o the right thing鈥?and honor the E70.00 rate. However, neither Expedia nor the credit card company could persuade Hotel Paris to do so.Hence the reason for this posting. STAY AWAY from Hotel Paris, Frankfurt, Germany!!
Reviews.Author: winterlilycat

Reviews.Content: Fine little hotel I am a solo, female traveller, aged 51. I found the Hotel Paris to be a charming little hotel in a great location, right across from the Frankfurt Hauptbahnhof (main railway station). The rooms are tastefully decorated with reasonably comfortable beds. Although the ensuites, are small (but not the smallest you could find in Europe) they are very clean. The breakfast room is very pleasant (they run CNN so you can catch the news in English. The elegant cutlery made eating the continental breakfast delightful. The only drawback at the time of my visit was that the hotel did not have an elevator and my room was on the 3rd floor. The desk attendant, however, did help me with the luggage and said the hotel would be installing an elevator in the near future. They speak reasonable English (and a couple of other languages) here, so they will help you find the local tour operators and advise on places to eat nearby. They will also call taxis for you, if necessary. Overall, I found this to be a fine little hotel that proved to be very good value for money.
Reviews.Author: Sanz

Reviews.Content: Simple but clean We stayed at this hotel two nights and are comletely satsfied. Rooms aren't very spacious, but clean. Shower was small but clean as well. Staff was friendly. Breakfest was quite normal.Positive:close to stationfriendly staffclean roomsNegativesmall roomsthey kept blocked summ of credit card more than two weeks after billing, so we have billed and the same sum (reservation sum) was bloced on credit card. Only after two weeks the unblocked this sum.
Reviews.Author: Huks

Reviews.Content: Great location, price and friendly staff We stayed at the Hotel Paris in Frankfurt last November (2005) and were really impressed with the quality. It is very close to the main train station, only a few blocks, and we were able to walk to the restaurants and shops. I was surprised to see quite a high price quoted when I started this review. During the low season (Nov), we were able to get a room for around 100 Euros. The room was clean and comfortable, and for those who are not very accustomed to European hotels, it might seem a little small, but we enjoyed it. The owner also owns the Tourist Hotel around the block and allowed us to us a PC to connect to the internet there. The women at the front desk were also quite accommodating when we asked for recommendations for dinner. Breakfast in the morning was also pleasant. I would definitely stay here again next time I'm in Frankfurt. While we were there, renovations were being completed, so by now, I'm sure the hotel is even better.
Reviews.Author: WorksforTravelMoney
